summary: The 'Preventing Antisemitic Harassment on Campus Act of 2025' amends the Civil Rights Act of 1964 and the Higher Education Act of 1965 to combat antisemitism in educational settings. It defines antisemitism, prohibits religious discrimination, and mandates rigorous enforcement of anti-discrimination laws in higher education.  The bill outlines sanctions, including fines and reporting requirements, for institutions violating these provisions. It also emphasizes that indifference to antisemitic harassment constitutes discrimination.
